alert.note: Alert for Westmoreland (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 12 at 8:37PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Westmoreland County through 900 PM EDT... At 837 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Colonial Beach, moving southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Colonial Beach, Montross, Coles Point, Lerty, Stratford Hall, Currioman Landing, Potomac Beach, Mount Holly, Erica, Westmoreland State and Templeman. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Strong wind gusts are possible with these storms. These wind gusts are capable of knocking down tree limbs, small or weakened trees, and blowing around trash cans, potted plants, lawn furniture, and other light outdoor objects.
